snippet: Recent changes to state policy and a growing national affection for the shellfish have led to an oyster farming boom that is hampering the traditional fishing ways of the watermen.
abstract: Oyster farming is booming on Western Chesapeake Bay shore of Maryland, due to recent changes to state policy and growing national affection for shellfish; in past few years state has issued 111 oyster farming leases across 2,240 acres of waters; watermen are in conflict, arguing cages used to cultivate oysters are menace to fishing lines and crab pots.
lead_paragraph: Recent changes to state policy and a growing national affection for the shellfish have led to an oyster farming boom that is hampering the traditional fishing ways of the watermen.

headline.main: A New Bounty of Oysters in Maryland, but There Is a Snag
headline.print_headline: A New Bounty of Oysters, but There Is a Snag
